main event: On June 8, 1959, a bright, high speed, silvery, circular object was observed in Washington, D.C.
interesting points: The object was traveling from southeast to northwest at an estimated speed of over 1,000 mph,It was about 20-30 feet in diameter and had a bright and metallic appearance,The observation lasted for 15-20 minutes during which the object accelerated and climbed out of sight, The object exhibited controlled flight characteristics unlike normal aircraft, Additional investigation data would be necessary for further evaluation.
witness description: a husband and wife who observed the object from their rooftop
